Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 42 minutes ago, Aelfhe1m said:
> 
> 
> (especially with orbital logistics making a come back in the latest Constellation beta).
> 

What is Constellation?

> 
> 
> Just now, TachyonGMZ said:
> 
> 
> What is Constellation?
> 

Constellation is the combination pack of all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods in one download - available from [GitHub](https://github.com/BobPalmer/USI_Constellation/releases). Pre-release betas are sometimes distributed this way as well.

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed974373429" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/154587-13-modular-kolonization-system-mks/&do=embed&comment=3240233&embedComment=3240233&embedDo=findComment" style="height:267px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Aelfhe1m said:
> 
> 
> Constellation is the combination pack of all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods in one download - available from [GitHub](https://github.com/BobPalmer/USI_Constellation/releases). Pre-release betas are sometimes distributed this way as well.
> 

Is it more up to date than individual mods and does it include that shipw which I have seen pictures of yet never found? It has a command pod that is like a barrel with windows facing forward almost like a hammerhead shark.

> 
> 
> 46 minutes ago, TachyonGMZ said:
> 
> 
> Is it more up to date than individual mods and does it include that shipw which I have seen pictures of yet never found? It has a command pod that is like a barrel with windows facing forward almost like a hammerhead shark.
> 

At the moment it is more up-to-date because the new beta is being tested but sometimes individual mods will get an update without a corresponding update to Constellation.

All the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods can be found on the [catalog web site](http://umbraspaceindustries.github.io/UmbraSpaceIndustries/) which is linked from roverdudes signature.

Freight Transport Technologies contains the Orca and Honeybadger heavy command pods. The Exploration Pack and Survival Pack have several tiny command pods.

It doesn't contain the part being asked for anymore, probably got deprecated in favor of the Orca command pod.

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, Nergal8617 said:
> 
> 
> It doesn't contain the part being asked for anymore, probably got deprecated in favor of the Orca command pod.
> 

Ah right. The old Starlifter pod was deprecated in FTT v.6.0.0.

If [@TachyonGMZ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172198-tachyongmz/) really wanted that part then I suppose they could download FTT v. 0.5.4 from GitHub, pull out the appropriate files and modify the config to modern standards. This would of course be strictly for personal use and **not be supported** by roverdude or the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> team.

I can live without it but its a shame.

If I wanted to balance 6.4x with how life support would function in stock should I triple hab time home time and supply time? I want a bigger system but with similar life support time to stock.

Slightly unrelated. What should i set reentry heating to with this rescale? [@Aelfhe1m](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142910-aelfhe1m/)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-23T23:43:57Z" title="12/23/2017 11:43  PM" data-short="6 yr">December 23, 2017</time> by TachyonGMZ**

Electricity doesn't change in the background. But life support modules require electricty to reduce supply consumption. Do they turn off as well on the backgorund or work without electricity? Should I install **background processing** or **background resources** mods to enable background electricity? I'm confused because they don't exist in installation requirements of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.
It works with the same constraints as stock, that is, at a certain point it disables EC consumption to prevent battery overrun.  Installing background processing mods may have unpredictable results.

WoW, reply in just 2 minutes. ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif ":kiss:")

So Recyclers and Nom-O-Matics work in the background and I don't have to carry enough battery to work under Mun's 3-day long nights.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-02T15:58:26Z" title="01/02/2018 03:58  PM" data-short="6 yr">January 2, 2018</time> by CanOmer**
  
Mun's rotation period 6 d 2 h 36 m 24.4 s

Depends... if you're under 100 warp then you are going to get battery drain.  But if you leave for a few months and come back, it is not going to try snagging more power than the batteries can support.

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, CanOmer said:
> 
> 
> WoW, reply in just 2 minutes. ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif ":kiss:")
> 
> 
> 
> So Recyclers and Nom-O-Matics work in the background and I don't have to carry enough battery to work under Mun's 3-day long nights.
> 

Better way to think about it (and closer to what's actually going on) is that \*none\* of that works in the background - it just pretends it does.  You show up and it quickly does everything as if it had happened in the background, using the current situation.

And yes this can be abused.  ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")  If you never check your solar-powered Mun base during the night, it'll say 'oh, you've got enough solar power for these to run, so they kept running'...  (On the other hand, note that the counters in the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS window are just straight-line approximations based on the last time those Kerbals were seen.  If it says you've run out of EC for some ship, and you've got solar panels and the next time you visit is during the day...  They've had EC.)

I begin a career with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS. Now I am at 20th day and visited Mun and Minmus. Can I add Modular Kolonization System (MKS) to my modlist safely in the mid of a career?

Hello all - this is not a support request but just an idea I've been banging around.

I'd like to build a small extension to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS that adds waste heat to occupied command pods.  Partly because of reading technical histories of the space program and how much goes into the thermal side of ELCSS, partly because there are a bunch of stock parts that work great but have no purpose, partly just to add a little spice. 

Nothing heavy-duty (no solar flux, no heat exchange with planets, etc), just a CoreHeat generator linked to Habitation that sheds heat via the stock heat mechanic.  Small enough flux that you can survive a couple orbits in a Mk1 pod before getting toasty, and a small fixed panel will cool a 1-2 crew pod indefinitely.  The electrical draw of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS habitation plus running the radiator seems reasonable already as a "justification" for where the heat comes from.

I'm hoping this can run entirely via <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches.  I'm not a coder, though I've been teaching myself <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> syntax and it's going OK.  I've tried some tests pasting in and modifying stock CoreHeat generators (from <abbr title="Radio-isotope Thermo-electric Generator (a.k.a. Mars rover heating device)">RTG</abbr>, drill etc), but there are so many variables tied together, I'm not even sure it had any effect. 

Right now I'm looking for a bit of feedback on whether this is possible with <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> or if I'm looking at a extra dll?  If this derails the main thread I'm happy to take it to PM or a topic in Add-On Discussions

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, CanOmer said:
> 
> 
> I begin a career with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS. Now I am at 20th day and visited Mun and Minmus. Can I add Modular Kolonization System (MKS) to my modlist safely in the mid of a career?
> 

Sure.  It'll add some parts, but I don't believe it does much to any of the parts you have.  If you want to be careful, you can recover any ships in flight and Kerbals, but I don't believe it will be necessary.  (Especially so early on in your career - you likely don't have any large life-support systems running yet.)

(Though it does seem like an ideal case for Indicator Lights support...)
wait do <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS works with DeepFreeze

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Mukita12 said:
> 
> 
> wait do <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS works with DeepFreeze
> 

Yes, it does.

What is your recommended Life Support Setup for realism?

In my opinion all effects except habitation should kill (K.I.A.) crew. Habitation should make crew grouchy (tourist). But I want to hear your recommendation.

I just created an entirely new 1.3.1 install and added <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS 0.7.0.0 from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, but when I go in game the green square button that lets me access the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS menus isn't showing up either in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> view, nor in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>. The only mods i've installed are <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS and it's dependencies (as defined by <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN)</abbr>.

Did something change with the most recent version? Is the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> install broken? Thanks!

**UPDATE**: Manually installed and it works fine - <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> is recommending <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> 3.0.1 wherein the manual install contains 2.8.1. Is that the issue?

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-16T01:44:03Z" title="01/16/2018 01:44  AM" data-short="6 yr">January 16, 2018</time> by Tyko**

I have a small UI request, I use Tourism Plus a lot which means a lot of kerbals needing life support, thus the life support status is clogged with over a hundred tourist kerbals on one station at the later parts of the game. So my request is just a way to minimize specific ships in the status screen, with it maybe just showing the sup/ec/hab/home of the kerbal with the lowest timer on that ship.
